title: FFmpegEncoder keeps writing frames after broken pipe, spamming errors
description:
FFmpegEncoder.consumeFrame() (line 72-83) catches IOException on write failure but continues accepting subsequent frames. When FFmpeg is killed (e.g., game process receives SIGHUP), every remaining frame triggers another failed write and another logged error.

Evidence:
- ~/mage-bench-logs/game_20260210_224830/spectator.log: "Failed to write frame 24648" with java.io.IOException: Broken pipe, followed by "FFmpeg exited with code: 129"

Source: FFmpegEncoder.java:80-82 â€” stdin.write() throws IOException, caught and logged, but no flag prevents future writes

Suggested fix: Add a volatile boolean pipeBroken field. Set it to true on first IOException in consumeFrame(). Short-circuit future writes when the flag is set.
